description:
very primitive and useless.
i don't need complaint matter by matter because of i can't see any useful and good point.
don't waste your time.

This provides an excellent interface for viewing duplicate files in a directory (and its subdirectories), but some of the options from the command-line tool don't appear to have been implemented in the GUI (such as tagging a directory), as with some GUI-specific options (such as having the output script reflect your keep/remove selections). Until these are resolved, it's best to use this tool to get your bearings, and then use rmlint on the command-line to fine-tune the options you want to generate the script.
summary: Good for viewing, but incomplete for removal

description: First GUI reaction-what is all that? After visiting website: https://rmlint.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial.html most of 'that' was explained. Soon had it plowing through 215000 files in one directory. Took only a few seconds to find 3000 duplicate files. After review, delete was easy. Easier than programs I used in windows. May praise and blessing be upon the creators.
Tried several times to install it. It installed, but wouln't launch.
summary: I couldn't get it to launch

description: Its not woriking in ubuntu 20.04

This app is the furthest thing from user friendly. It is incomprehensible. The graphic pie chart is lousy, the layout and information given is extremely poor. The was no thought given to the average user when this was created.
summary: Very poorly done. don't waste your time

description: Such a simple program and not working at all, i have many duplicates and it seems it's no even scanning
Allows user to select directories to scan. But does nothing under Ubunti 20.

Would have been great if it actually found duplicates, but it doesn't seem to work at all. Pretends to scan 300GB in about 1 second. I filled a folder with copies of a file where only the filename was different. No duplicates found even if the folder alone was specified. This is on Ubuntu 20.04.
Searching any directory in the file system results in zero found files.
rmlint --gui does not produce any matches with default settings, reported in https://github.com/sahib/rmlint/issues/437 together with the workaround.
summary: GUI works after small change in Settings

description: When run on my system it showed no results in the pie chart, running it from the command line I found that the settings size option was causing the commands it ran to fail. The 16 petabyte setting max size was the fault and after I pulled it down to 100 gigabytes it was working.
summary: Did not work out of the box

description: It can find duplicate files but running the delete script always says 0 Bytes removed, even in "delete" mode. Tried it on Ubuntu 18 and now on 20 with the same results :-( It's of no use if you actually want to easily delete your duplicates. FSLINT was so much better..
not working- no files found, is not finding any duplicates

We give a directory to this software
and he is not able to find duplicate from that point.
Looks nice but it seems to search only within a single directory, not across multiple folders
summary: Not able to search across folders

description:
After consolidating all my music libraries, I installed product and reduced size limit to 50GB.
Ran and found all dups. Did dry run on deletion page. then went thru actual deletion process.
No Prob.
It is great, but not so easy to understand at first
I used this app with success in the past but it is no longer scanning the folders it seems.
summary: It does not show any results

description: Useless. Does not work. It appears Debian removed the functional app fslint and kept the non-functional app Shredder. Dupe Guru installation is blocked. Now we have no duplicate finder in the repository.
rmlint works but this (launched via gui or with rmlint --gui) does not work.
This app can't even scan folders redundantly, and finds no duplicates despite there being plenty there. It's more effective to manually list and remove than to use this joke of a "tool".
Scans very shortly but never finds any duplicates.
doesn't find any duplicate
great tool (the only one left since fslint and dupeguru dont work on 20.04)
summary: works well but uses alot of CPU

description: Running rmlint shows the proper output. Running the GUI doesn't work at all. It is unable to read its own json file.
Nothing because there are many double and triple identical files in my music collection

Hice un backup de mis archivos compare 
las dos unidades y shredder no encontro 
un solo archivo duplicado

très bien
un seul bémol, la version actuelle a un bug, il faut aller dans les paramètre, tout en bas pour changer la "size limit" supérieure, sinon il ne détecte pas les duplicats. Le bug est résolu mais c'est la version buguée qui passe dans les dépots. Remplacez 16 péta par 100go et ce logiciel deviendra votre ami.

Unfortunalty, the application seems to be unable to do searchs in veracrypt modules, so it's rather useless for me.
Give us fslint back !
J'ai selectionné des repertoires avec des doublons et recherche instantanée sans résultat
des milliers de doublons sur des centaines de GO ca ne lui fait pas peur
Comme précisé dans le commentaire précédent il faut effectuer quelques modifications dans les parametres
je n'ai malheureusement pas compris comment effacer les doublons, j'ai encore passer beaucoup de temps sur des programmes linus tres peu intuitifs...
summary: ou est la commande "effacer les doublons" ?
